wiki.content: As the Years Go Passing By is a song credited to have been written by ”Deadric Malone″ (a pseudonym of Don Robey). Other sources claim that the song was penned by Peppermint Harris for Fenton Robinson, who first recorded it in 1959. The most known versions are those by Albert King (1967) and Eric Burdon & The Animals, who recorded it for their last album, Love Is in 1968. Other artists who covered As the Years Go Passing By are: - Ken Arconti - Maggie Bell - Big Brother & The Holding Company - Elvin Bishop - David Bromberg Band - John Lee Carter - Jeff Healey - John Lee Hooker - Al Kooper - Gary Moore - Michael Packer -Gregg Rolie - Otis Rush - Carlos Santana - Savoy Brown - Boz Scaggs - Sting - George Thorogood - Bill Sims User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary:
As the Years Go Passing By is a song credited to have been written by ”Deadric Malone″ (a pseudonym of Don Robey). Other sources claim that the song was penned by Peppermint Harris for Fenton Robinson, who first recorded it in 1959.
 The most known versions are those by Albert King (1967) and Eric Burdon & The Animals, who recorded it for their last album, Love Is in 1968.  Other artists who covered As the Years Go Passing By are:     - Ken Arconti
    - Maggie Bell

track.name: As The Years Go Passing By
comments: A non-trivial approach to his compositions on the verge of several genres and styles of music, has led many fans of blues to draw look at his work. His unusual style of performance, somewhere on the border of blues and rock, are interested many collectors. He creates fantastic tunes that always filled with various emotions. He is looking for the identification of human emotions in different forms of performing.
....just bought it. Bam!
Man, this is sooo laid back. I'm gonna buy the album right now!
As the Years Go Passing By

Wow. This was a great track. Nice tone.

He is the all around King. Check his chops out with Colliseum 2, Thin Lizzy and his solos stuff before this CD. Paresienne Walkways may be the greatest song you never heard. He recorded it about 1000 times. Find it before you die.

RIP Gazza. Thanks for the great music.
